title: What if the Nazi didn't hate Jews? - Quora

response.answer_text: If the Nazis weren’t anti-semitic but every other aspect of them remained the same, then it would not have made any significant difference to the outcome of the war. With Hitler’s sense of hubris and hatred of communism, even without his belief of Bolshevist links with world Jewry, he would still have invaded the Soviet Union in 1941 in pursuit of “Lebensraum”. German Jews accounted for less than 1% of Germany’s population, totaling some 600,000, and the number of Jewish men available who would’ve been conscripted or joined the German armed forces would have been statistically insignificant in terms of victory. Even without the resources and manpower diverted to the Holocaust, with a Soviet Union fully mobilized, Germany would still have ultimately faced defeat by Russia based on shear numbers and lack of resources, and even without it’s genocidal policies, would also have been viewed as a threat to western democracies, who would have combined to stop it.

It is possible that the Nazis would have won in that alternative history. Just imagine all those Jewish physicists developing weapons for Germany instead of America, to say nothing of having more troops and resources available to fight the Allies.
